Resume

I have a combined 7 years of experience in designing for and building the web.

With a formal background in psychology, my strengths lie in analyzing human behavior from quantitative and qualitative user research. I use these insights to inspire or back up the design rationale behind new and better products.

Work experience

Rock Creek Strategic Marketing/CHIEF

Senior User Experience Strategist

Helping define the vision for a growing UX team at a digital strategy agency that specializes in government products.

  • Design, moderate, analyze, and present UX research for 2 government products, including re-design of the Securities and Exchange Commission's EDGAR database.
  • Working with UX practice lead to act as mentor and supervisor to 2 members of UX team.
  • Establishing a more effective design review process within UX, and with marketing, development, and project management teams.
  • Working with Creative Director and agency Partners to develop client pitches.

Current

Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB)

User Experience Strategist (Rock Creek Strategic Marketing)

Interface design, user experience research, and HTML prototyping for in-house design team. The CFPB is a 21st century federal government agency that engages consumers to take more control over their financial lives.

  • Helped establish a culture of collaboration and iteration between the UX team and product owners, visual design, and development teams.
  • Championed the adaptation of an Agile process across entire in-house team, working with coaches to explore sustainable workflows for UX on projects of varying scope and team size.
  • Specialized in data-heavy products, creating interfaces for data experts and visualizations for non-expert audiences.
  • Introduced behavioral and persuasive design strategies across team to create testable, more effective consumer products and information campaigns.
  • Partnered with other federal agencies to promote the CFPB's open source products as a vehicle for a more transparent government.

Demonstrated ability to lead, drive product vision, and integrate psychological research into design strategy resulted in promotion to Senior User Experience Strategist.

2012 - 2015

Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB)

Interactive Designer (Rock Creek Strategic Marketing)

A generalist role for a designer comfortable with wearing many hats. Responsible for taking print, digital, and interactive work to production.

  • Helped develop brand guidelines for Bureau, using previous research experience to focus on best practices for data visualizations.
  • Worked with product owners, engineers, and project managers to maximize resources and impact for the CFPB's small in-house design and development team.

Demonstrated ability to work with product owners to align stakeholders, design, and development teams resulted in promotion to User Experience Strategist.

2012 - 2012

Freelance

Design and Technology consultant

Working with clients to define vision and develop strategy for digital products and content. Team includes up to two resources.

  • Services for clients cover the user experience and creative design process, including user and market research, personas, heuristic analyses, interactive prototypes, wireframes, content analyses, and visual design.
  • Experience in recruiting and hiring for building in-house digital teams.

Web and IT Specialist

AILA provides research resources, continuing education, and substantive news to immigration law community. Used HTML/CSS/jQuery skills to publish custom content for five WordPress-based web properties. Performed heuristic evaluations, and used member feedback to make usability recommendations to web team.

2011 - 2012

Apple, Inc.

Genius

Provided the best technical support and repairs in the consumer electronics industry. Completed Genius Training at Cupertino, CA headquarters, earning an Apple Certified Macintosh Technician (ACMT) certification.

  • Handled difficult situations with uncanny poise in a fast-paced, dynamic retail environment.
  • Mastered proprietary, empathy-based customer service techniques.
  • Built relationships with customers by demonstrating burning desire to solve problems and communicating concepts in lay terms.
  • Solved software problems in 15 minutes or less for frontline customer support; performed repairs across entire line of present and past Apple products. 
2009 - 2010

The George Washington University

Research Assistant, Department of Psychology

Provided mental health services and educational aptitude testing, performed statistical analyses, and filled system administrator role for Department of Psychology.

  • Strengthened ability to interview, observe, empathize with, and to solve problems with both individuals and groups.
  • Developed impartial, consistent testing skills.
  • Developed ability to collect and interpret both quantitative and qualitative data for large-budget, longitudinal research, as well as low- budget guerrilla techniques.
